bookAuthors: Lord Byron, Truman Guy Steffan, Peter J. Manning, Susan J. Wolfson
Plot: Probably few subjects fitted Byron's particular talents better than Don Juan. In this rambling, exuberant, conversational poem, the travels of Don Juan are used as a vehicle for some of the most lively and acute commentaries on human societies and behaviour in the language. The manner is what Goethe called 'a cultured comic language'-a genre which he regarded as not possible in Geman and which he felt Byron managed superbly.
